skill.name: pylabrobot
skill.description: Laboratory automation toolkit for controlling liquid handlers, plate readers, pumps, heater shakers, incubators, centrifuges, and analytical equipment. Use this skill when automating laboratory workflows, programming liquid handling robots (Hamilton STAR, Opentrons OT-2, Tecan EVO), integrating lab equipment, managing deck layouts and resources (plates, tips, containers), reading plates, or creating reproducible laboratory protocols. Applicable for both simulated protocols and physical hardware control.
skill.summary: Laboratory automation toolkit for controlling liquid handlers, plate readers, pumps, heater shakers,...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code, no data access, no network operations, and no code execution paths. Content matches stated laboratory automation purpose.

content.value_statement: Manual lab workflows are slow and error prone. This skill guides you to build automated, repeatable protocols across liquid handlers and instruments.
actual_capabilities: Configure liquid handlers and run aspirate, dispense, and transfer steps
Manage deck layouts and lab resources like plates, tips, and troughs
Switch between hardware backends and simulation without rewriting protocols
Integrate plate readers and scales into automated workflows
Visualize and validate protocols with the browser visualizer
limitations: Real device control requires supported hardware and proper connections
Some device features are documented as under development
Examples assume asynchronous Python usage and event loop setup
Networked robots require correct IP and access permissions

use_cases.title: Build liquid transfer protocol
use_cases.description: Create a multi-step transfer workflow with tip tracking and volume tracking.

use_cases.title: Run plate reading assay
use_cases.description: Combine sample prep on a liquid handler with absorbance reads on a plate reader.

use_cases.title: Simulate and validate protocol
use_cases.description: Use the simulation backend and visualizer to test workflows before hardware runs.

prompt_templates.title: Start a simple transfer
prompt_templates.prompt: Show a minimal PyLabRobot protocol that transfers 100 uL from A1 to A2 using a Hamilton STAR backend.

prompt_templates.title: Switch to simulation
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert my protocol to use ChatterboxBackend and enable tip and volume tracking.

prompt_templates.title: Integrate plate reader
prompt_templates.prompt: Add CLARIOstar plate reader steps after sample transfer and return absorbance data handling tips.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-device workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a workflow that uses a liquid handler, a scale, and a plate reader with proper setup and cleanup.

output_examples.input: Create a protocol to replicate a 96 well plate with simulation and visualization.
output: Use ChatterboxBackend and start the Visualizer
Assign tip rack, source plate, and destination plate to deck rails
Pick up tips, transfer each column, then drop tips
Stop the liquid handler and visualizer after completion

best_practices: Test protocols in simulation before running on hardware
Enable tip and volume tracking for accurate state management
Always call setup and stop for each device
anti_patterns: Running hardware protocols without connection checks
Mixing backend specific calls into backend agnostic protocols

faq.question: Is this compatible with my robot?
faq.answer: It supports Hamilton STAR, Opentrons OT-2, Tecan EVO, and simulation. Check current device support in docs.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: Some device features are still in development and hardware access is required for real runs.

faq.question: Can I integrate multiple devices?
faq.answer: Yes. Examples show liquid handlers, plate readers, and scales in one workflow.

faq.question: Does it access my data or keys?
faq.answer: No. The skill content is documentation and examples only, with no data collection behavior.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot connection errors?
faq.answer: Verify cables or IP, ensure exclusive access, and run setup to confirm device readiness.

faq.question: How does it compare to manual scripting?
faq.answer: It provides a unified API, simulation tools, and reusable patterns for reliable automation.
